It's half life so it's fun. But this is probably the worst way to play it tbh.

The new physics are good but weird shit happens sometimes because of it (ex:Dropped weapons often get stuck in the air or in walls, enemies will fall through the floor) The AI is alot better, but most scientists and sometimes other friendly NPCs have an issue where they will yell and scream as if they're being attacked, even if nothing is happening. 

Theres also better lighting and water, which would benefit the game if the textures were updated as well. Instead it just looks out of place.

In short: I've experienced god knows how many glitches and issues in just the first chunk of the game. It also doesn't include Deathmatch: source, so you have to purchase that seperately. If you want the best way to play the game, buy the original and maybe install Half Life: Restored.
The first non-multiplayer game I have sat down to play in it's entirety, and it was pretty fun and challenging. Half-Life is just one of those games you HAVE to play once in your life.

Half-Life: Source was the only Half-Life game I haven't played and after playing it, I only feel disappointed. While some elements of this remaster look much better like the flashlight and water, most of the upgrades look out of place due to the fact that the models and textures are virtually unchanged from the first Half-Life. As well they are some awful visual bugs in some specific chapters like Residue Processing and Surface Tension which makes some of these chapters awful to play. However, I think the biggest issue is the changes to the damage model which is super unbalanced and makes the combat way worst than the original Half-Life.
Black Mesa: GoldSRC
Ğ‘Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¥Ğ°Ğ»Ñ„Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾ÑƒÑ

A horrible port of the original Half-Life. Although it has some things going for it, like improved lighting and particle effects, the bad outweighs the good here. Countless bugs and glitches including floating scientists, broken AI, invincible guards, glitchy skyboxes, and even a screen flickering glitch that could possibly cause seizures. Yikes. And that's not even all of them. Do not buy this game. It's a waste of money, even on sale.

This is not only the best Kart Racing sim, but for me the most realistic feeling sim out there. 
Very well done. 
This sim is immediately exhilarating and feels real the moment you put your foot down. If you've driven Karts before you get a good sense of feeling the limits and every lap can be rewarding from the moment you play. When you come off the throttle or hard accelerate through corners there is some weighty feel to the Karts and the force feedback has been done well without being overwhelming like others. The karts just feel right (unlike the Karts in Automobilista where I felt like you're on a bed of springs under power and braking and then a Jet Ski on water when lifting off, horrible in comparison)

For me it's worth every penny as I've always missed Karting from my younger days and have never had enough money to start again. The feeling came straight back. I purchased a T150 wheel and Playseat Challenge on a budget and I'm using an old 720P projector so sacrificing graphic quality for the big screen experience, but I wouldn't have been disappointed if I'd paid for more expensive kit. (To hire a 2-stroke Kart you're looking at 100-200 euros per hour!)

Unfortunately there is no AI to race (yet?) there are some online servers where you need to be lucky to find others at the same time. It does have your fastest laps in a Ghost Kart which is an excellent trainer and you will keep improving. 
If you're serious about wanting to experience the buzz of 2-stroke Karting (where F1 drivers learnt and still use to train in the winter)  then buy this and encourage your friends to get it too.

If you go to the developer's forum you can find organised online race events with people who seem friendly and helpful who are racing for the buzz of Karting not their egos. There are also links to download extra tracks like Kimbolton in the UK where they hold the Super One finals and Formula TKM festival. 
Having the three Genk Belgium tracks as standard is a great coup as this has been one of the best Karting facilities in Europe. The small Genk hire Kart circuit encourages so much race craft you'll also see seasoned racers there in real life honing their skills (and probably on this software too). 
My only wish is for the developers to add the slower and heavier Sodi Kart 390cc 4-stroke to help train the rest of the family as even the Mini  2-stroke Karts are manic!

UPDATE: They have now added a 4-stroke Kart!  A fast one, but still gives the correct feel and sound for people going to hire art circuits.

halof life sauceğŸ˜”

Same old nostalgic trip back to the 90's with a slight revamp in the 00's.

If you've never played I strongly recommend. Good combat, puzzle solving, large variety of weapons, enemies and map puzzling. Most scenarios have more than one approach, be it a slight application of stealth, superior firepower or searching for a vent that will give you a better vantage point.

Best parts have to be fighting the soldiers. Just when you think you have the old 90s AI figured out they are tossing grenades at your position and waiting for you to be flushed out into their line of fire. Some Alien AI lacking though, the Vorts and Grunts become incredibly predicable, they will always rush your position by shortest route as all their attacks are Melee or direct line of sight based (no grenades or squad AI). The Hound-Eyes are superior in a way (simple dog like creatures), if you encounter one it will run to the pack and come back at you in greater numbers.
Most advanced half life yet, with a man sitting above a chair. Talk about good physics!

it just counts as a neat little bonus from the half life complete pack, a very little one
it's just lazily ported half life in the source engine, fixed some minor bugs but have more bugs than the original
at least Xen looks a bit better with the source lightning, but nothing much more than ragdoll's and lightning, also weapon bobbing but who cares, just buy regular half life, very playable on modern hardware, very recommended
In short dont buy this
buy regular half life
(or black mesa if you already played regular half life and need a new way to experience it)

if you have half life 1 already don't buy this, if you are getting it for gmod, only get it for gmod, its a buggy (Really buggy), shitty version of half life 1, its most redeeming quality is that its half life, i guess, not really. the only scary part of this version is the fact valve let it release. its almost imposible on the easiest setting 90% of the time, no where near as hard as hard mode on half life 1, every change made to this version is made to piss you off, the most fun i had playing this version was the fact 2 npc's got stuck in the ground (bug), it was a amusing but lasted a few seconds. out of all my 11 hours of this version i came across 30-35 bugs, seriously only get this for gmod.
